reviews.review: I'm going to start by saying I regret buying this game years after at such a low price, and that is in 2008. This is THE game, Halo,Gears of War, almost every modern shooter would not be half the game it is if not for the visionary design of Half-Life 2. You can ask any designer in the action games genre and there's no doubt Half-Life 2 will be at the top of their most influensial games. This game went where the first couldn't, Valve pushed the technology and even too kthe time to make an engine that, to this day, looks amazing and plays smooth on most any system. I could wasily go on for hours telling you about the visionary blend of gameplay mechanics and storyline that makes Half-Life 2 one of the most revolutionary games ever, leaping buildings where the first only pushed boundries...
THE BEST GAME EVER ;D
Source game you should buy if you want Garry's Mod, it is a long game and has a great plot and story and the voice actting and graphics are great also so you should get this game.

You haven't played Half-Life 2? Seriously?

Half-Life était excellent, Half-Life² le dépasse sur à peu près tous les points. Graphiquement on a le Source Engine version 2010, pas le plus beau mais qui restitue bien les environnements divers que l'équipe artistique à rendu réaliste au possible dans l'univers de science fiction propre à Half-Life. Niveau gameplay on a un FPS classique, mais l'ajout du Gravity Gun et des mécaniques de jeu orientées physiques (jouer avec le décor pour tuer les ennemis par exemple) crée une particularité, presque une révolution du gameplay. Une liberté quasi totale. La durée de vie est excellente, le prix est faible (préférez l'Orange Box qui a l'intégrale HL2 plus Portal et TF2 pour le tout petit prix de 20€) et la qualité est exemplaire. On pousse plus loin l'intrigue avec de nouveaux personnages. Encore une fois trop à dire, mais c'est un classique absolu recommandé pour tous.
Could be considered a Holy Grail in the world of gaming. Not a boring moment!
Huge in scope, WORTH the money!

THIS. Is a game with some of the best FPS action mixed with some of the best story telling ever used in the First-Person Shooter genre.  By far my favorite game of adolescence.  Although I may grow out of it, it remains a cornerstone of game design philosophy and great story telling and pacing in the video game industry.  My hat is off to ye at Valve Corp. for bringing this jewel into existence...
One of the best single player games ever created!

The gameplay is awesome, The physics are unbelivable, The story is great. 
I strongly Recommend this game.
Best game ever, no doubt  :)

The game that launched Source. This title is not to be missed. While a little dated in terms of visuals, gameplay is still just as solid as ever. This title is still better than 90% of single player shooters out there. Pick this one and give ep 1 & 2 a play through as well to experience the updated graphics and even more gameplay innovations. Play Gordon Freeman as both the story and the technology behind the Source engine evovle to bring one of the most gripping action tales you'll ever have the luxury of experiencing.
In my opinion, one of the most interesting and addictive FPS games ever. Learn the story (not necessarily by playing HL) and play this game and it's two chronological episodes.
The game is worth the cash! The game is the most epic first person shooter that I've ever played!

I have never been much of a 1st person shooter fan, this game has made me one.  It does not do anything particularly new ... shoot enemies, pick up power-ups, unlock doors, ride in vehicles, explore various environments, solve puzzles .... but this game does all of those things correctly, and that is what separates it from the pack.  Beautiful graphics, cool weapons, perfectly paced, varied lush environments, and puzzles perfectly blended together.  If you have never been a fan of first person shooters, this game will change your mind ... and for only $10.00, there is no way you can go wrong!  I give it a 10 out of 10 - A SPECTACULAR SURPRISE!

Sometimes, things occur in entertainment that raise the bar. They create a new level, a standard to which all things following it will be compared. Often, these boundaries are then broken by another equally brilliant item that comes along in the next few years. 
Here stands one such item that since 2004 has not been bested. Half Life 2 is, in my opinion, the best game ever made. That title belongs to many classic arcade games for some, but I find the positives and almost absolute lack of negatives of HL2 as undeniable.
Technically, it excels in both it's engine and it's level design, clearly a work of artisans. An unparalleled physics engine that uncannily represents realism is played against a superbly detailed world that plays host to a haunting beauty that I cannot describe with mere words. Whether it's your first steps into Ravenholm, the first time you hurtle a barrel across the scrapyard with the gravity-gun or the first time Alyx smiles at you, everyone who has ever played HL2 has a fantastic memory of how it looks and plays.

The story also deserves a special mention: Finding itself somewhere between a sophisticated psycho-thriller and a Phillip K. Dickian future, it will leave a brilliant sense of space and threat in you for days.

There is nothing in my opinion that ascends to the height of Half Life 2 in terms of story and mechanics. It paces itself beautifully, starting slowly and exploding into a Wagnarian flurry of motion and emotion that defies mortal description. 

If you haven't played this game, then you really must. It is something deeply special that I sincerely think all gamers should worship as a piece of genius. Play, live and enjoy it.
One of the top 10 greatest games of all time and you still need to read recommendations. just get it already.

Once upon a time, Half-Life 2 was THE game to play if you wanted a single player experience. The graphics were incredible, the weapons were all fun to use (especially the famous gravity gun), and it added more to the cinematic approach that the first Half-Life had. It was the gem of that era, but that era is long gone. 

Playing Half-Life 2 without modding today doesn't give the same excitement that it did years ago. The once impressive graphics now look old, especially when you notice the re-use of character models throughout the game. The weapons are no longer as cool, as Valve themselves topped the Gravity Gun with the portal gun years later. The cinematic portions are now a chore as many other games have tried being more cinematic, except unlike Half-life 2 they allow you to skip it. 

I'm not saying that the game itself is bad, in fact you can still have some fun shooting combine soldiers. However, the game unfortunately can no longer live up to the high standards it set up for itself years ago.

La historia y ambientacion no me gustaron tanto como en la primera parte, pero fue el titulo que estreno el afamado "source engine", un motor tan potente que incluso a dia de hoy sigue dando guerra. No lo cuento entre mis preferidos, pero sin duda alguna merece la pena probarlo.

This game is above criticism.

Well it was when it was released.  Today I think we can claim it is not as pretty as Crysis, but what would be the point?  It is still the game by which all other first person shooters are measured.

It is the Casablanca of modern PC games.  The common frame of reference from which all comparisons can be made.

You owe it to yourself to play it and understand why it is the benchmark.

Méltó folytatás, de még nincs befejezve a történet - tipikus rókabőr eset, de elnézhető. Az AI ma szemmel átlagos, viszont a játék története nagyon jó. Kevés olyan játék van, ahol meneküléssel foglalkozik a játék majd a feléig - utána pedig jobbnál jobb akciók vannak. Sok jó ötlet található benne, ami miatt még jobban szerethető. Pár Archivement szinesiti a storyt, de attol fuggetlenul max 3x jatszanam vegig.

Fantastic FPS! Probably second to only the first Call of Duty single player campaign. It's an ok shooter up until the point you go to Ravenholm and acquire the gravity gun. The gravity gun is probably the most fun weapon to use in any FPS. You can pull an enemy in with your gravity gun then fire him back at his homie killing them both.  It's a bit dated now, but still quite excellent. I highly recommend!
Still waiting on Episode 3

Introducing the Source Engine, this game is a milestone in gaming history.
Released in 2004, Valve's Source Engine was able to render realistic physics that are still arguably the best. It's graphics, artificial inteligence, and facial animation were revolutionary, especially for this time.

The game puts you in the H.E.V. suit of Gordon Freeman coming out of statis, 20 years after the events of Half-Life, making his way through the Combine Forces, crowbar in hand. From the urban-swamps of City 17 to the haunted, infected town of Ravenholm, and from the seaside coastline of Highway 17 to the prison of Nova Prospekt, all the environments flow together, providing a simple, yet riviting base story for the player (and, if you're curious enough, and extremely deep back story).

All in all, Half-Life 2 is a must-have for nearly every PC gamer, especially for shooter fans, and is an experience you aren't likely to forget.
